jparsec.graph

Class DataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.DataSet

  • public class DataSet
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to perform useful operations with datasets.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      • createXYDataset

        public static java.util.ArrayList<double[]> createXYDataset(java.lang.String function,
                                            double x0,
                                            double xf,
                                            int npoints)
                                                     throws JPARSECException
        Creates an xy dataset of values from a given function.
        Parameters:
        function - Function f(x) as it is written in Java.
        x0 - Initial x value of the dataset.
        xf - Final x value.
        npoints - Number of points.
        Returns:
        A ArrayList with two arrays of doubles: the x and the y values.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • applyFunction

        public static double[] applyFunction(java.lang.String function,
                     double[] val)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Creates an array of values by applying a math operation to all the values. For example, a function "5*x" creates a new array with the same values multiplied by 5.
        Parameters:
        function - Function f(x) as it is written in Java.
        val - Array of values.
        Returns:
        An array with the result of the operation applied to each value in the array.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

                                                                            throws JPARSECException
        Obtain double precision values of an array of strings, including possible upper and lower limits, such as "<5" or ">5". Math operations are allowed, for example "5*3" in any component.

                                      java.lang.String[] limit_arg)
                                               throws JPARSECException
        Obtain double precision values of an array of strings, excluding possible upper and lower limits, such as "<5" or ">5". Math operations are allowed, for example "5*3" in any component.
        Parameters:
        arg - Array of strings, with numbers or math operations, and with or without limit information.
        limit_arg - Array of strings to be also checked, if, for example, limits are set only in one axis and you want to exclude points with limits in the other axis.
        Returns:
        The array of double values in arg with no limit information.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • parseDouble

        public static double parseDouble(java.lang.String s)
        Parses a double to a String. Performance compared to intrinsic java method varies a lot: between 20% faster to 100% faster depending on the input values. The trick is to use Long.parseLong, which is extremely fast. This method calls FastMath.parseDouble(String).
        Parameters:
        s - The string.
        Returns:
        The double value.

      • parseFloat

        public static float parseFloat(java.lang.String s)
        Parses a float from a String. Performance compared to intrinsic java method varies a lot: between 20% faster to 400% faster depending on the input values. This method calls FastMath.parseDouble(String).
        Parameters:
        s - The string.
        Returns:
        The double value.

      • formatTable

        public static java.lang.String[] formatTable(java.lang.String[] table,
                             java.lang.String separator,
                             int order)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Formats a table by ordering the elements in ascending/descending mode for a given column, and maintaining the length of each column.
        Parameters:
        table - Table to format.
        separator - Separator used in the table.
        order - Field number to order (>= 1). If positive, that field will be ordered in crescent. If negative, in descent. Set to 0 to maintain ordering as input.
        Returns:
        Formatted table.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • toStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] toStringArray(java.lang.String text,
                               java.lang.String separator)
        Transforms a string into an array for a given field separator. This functions uses intrinsic StringTokenizer to separate the fields. For short Strings it is faster to call toStringArray(String, String, boolean). In addition, take into account that the intrinsic function could skip empty values assuming two consecutive separators as only one.
        Parameters:
        text - Text.
        separator - Separator.
        Returns:
        Array.

                               int l)

        Parameters:
        text - Text.
        l - Length of each element in the output array.
        Returns:
        Array.

      • extractSubTable

        public static java.lang.String[] extractSubTable(java.lang.String[] table,
                                 java.lang.String separator,
                                 int columnIndex,
                                 java.lang.String value)
        Extracts a fraction of a table that matches the value of a given column.
        Parameters:
        table - Data for table.
        separator - Separator string.
        columnIndex - Column index, from 0 to number of columns - 1.
        value - Value of the column. If the column defined by the previous index is equals to this value, the row will be extracted.
        Returns:
        The data that matches the condition.

        public static java.lang.String[] addRowInTable(java.lang.String[] table,
                               java.lang.String newRow,
                               int rowIndex)
        Adds a row in a given table. Separator should be the same!
        Parameters:
        table - Data for table.
        newRow - Data for new row.
        rowIndex - Row index for the new row, from 0 to number of rows.
        Returns:
        The same data including row column if the row index is valid.

      • replaceAll

        public static java.lang.String replaceAll(java.lang.String table,
                          java.lang.String symbol,
                          java.lang.String replacement,
                          boolean hasStrangeSymbols)
        Replaces all matches of a string with another string.
        Parameters:
        table - String to be modified.
        symbol - String to search for.
        replacement - String to replace the last one. If null the replacement will be with an empty string.
        hasStrangeSymbols - True if the symbol/replacement has 'strange symbols' like backslashes or so. If true direct String method will be used (indexOf), if false intrinsic replaceAll will be used (faster). A basic test that searches for strange symbols is done to try to avoid problems when using intrinsic String.replaceAll(String, String).
        Returns:
        The new string with the replacements.

      • replaceOne

        public static java.lang.String replaceOne(java.lang.String table,
                          java.lang.String symbol,
                          java.lang.String replacement,
                          int pos)
        Replaces all matches of a string with another string. This functions works better than the intrinsic String.replaceFirst(String, String).
        Parameters:
        table - String to be modified.
        symbol - String to search for.
        replacement - String to replace the last one.
        pos - Position of the coincidence, starting from 1 (first).
        Returns:
        The new string with the replacements.

      • replaceAll

        public static java.lang.String[] replaceAll(java.lang.String[] array,
                            java.lang.String symbol,
                            java.lang.String replacement,
                            boolean hasStrangeSymbols)
        Replaces all matches of a string with another string.
        Parameters:
        array - String array to be modified.
        symbol - String to search for.
        replacement - String to replace the last one.
        hasStrangeSymbols - True if the symbol/replacement has 'strange symbols' like backslashes or so. If true direct String method will be used (indexOf), if false intrinsic replaceAll will be used (faster).
        Returns:
        The new string array with the replacements.

      • replaceOne

                            int pos)

        symbol - String to search for.
        replacement - String to replace the last one.

      • isDoubleFastCheck

        public static boolean isDoubleFastCheck(java.lang.String s)
        Checks if a given String is a double number or not, using a 'fast check'. Fast check just checks if the String contains some invalid characters, any of these: ABCDFGHIJKLNOPQRSTUVWXYZ/*+()%&<>?abcdeghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz.
        Parameters:
        s - The string.
        Returns:
        True or false. Note a double string can be valid while starting with a +.

      • isDoubleOrMathOperationFastCheck

        public static boolean isDoubleOrMathOperationFastCheck(java.lang.String s)
        Checks if a given String is a double number or a possibly valid math operation, using a 'fast check'. Fast check just checks if the String contains some invalid characters, any of these: ABCDFGHJKLNOQRSTUVWXYZjkvwz.
        Parameters:
        s - The string.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • isDoubleStrictCheck

        public static boolean isDoubleStrictCheck(java.lang.String s)
        Checks if a given String is a double number or not, using a 'strict check' and without launching exceptions. Check is similar to what Java internally does, but it is slow.
        Parameters:
        s - The string.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • flip2dArray

        public static java.lang.Object flip2dArray(java.lang.Object o,
                           boolean flip12,
                           boolean invert1,
                           boolean invert2)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Flips the data in a 2d array.
        Parameters:
        o - The input array 2d, type primitive double, int, float, short, or byte.
        flip12 - True to flip the values in input array in axis 1 and 2, where the array is, for instance, int[axis 1 values][axis 2 values].
        invert1 - True to invert the position of the output values in axis 1 for the output array.
        invert2 - True to invert the position of the output values in axis 2 for the output array.
        Returns:
        Flipped array.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the type of the input data cannot be recognized.
